maxairesources.logging package

Submodules

maxairesources.logging.logger module

class maxairesources.logging.logger.CustomAdapter(logger, extra)[source]

Bases: LoggerAdapter

Example ` from maxairesources.logging.logger import get_logger #import function logger = get_logger(__name__) #get logger logger.debug(f"log this debug message") #log debug message `

process(msg, kwargs)[source]

Process the logging message and keyword arguments passed in to a logging call to insert contextual information. You can either manipulate the message itself, the keyword args or both. Return the message and kwargs modified (or not) to suit your needs.

Normally, you’ll only need to override this one method in a LoggerAdapter subclass for your specific needs.

maxairesources.logging.logger.get_file_handler(level, filename='run_details.log')[source]

returns file handler for log

maxairesources.logging.logger.get_logger(name, level=10)[source]

returns logger as per filename / module name

maxairesources.logging.logger.get_stream_handler(level)[source]

get stream to show logs on terminal
